ok thanks: when you are troubleshooting, it's a very bad idea to say "my fstab is fine."  Perhaps it is, but you have a problem, and you don't know what is causing it, and eliminating fstab isn't a good place to start.

lol, no offense taken. how do i run something as strace?
suppose you are running the command    mount -t iso9660 /dev/cdrom /mnt/cdrom    to run under strace, you do:   strace -o strace.mount -ff mount -t iso9660 ...
http://enja.org/david/strace_mount.txt

it is saying there is no cd in /dev/cdrom0
that either means that /dev/cdrom0 isn't pointing at your drive.  Or it could mean the drive is not configured correctly.  Or it could be that you forgot to put the cd in.  :)
